alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 29 at 10:32AM CST until January 04 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in North Dakota... Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. .Water from previous heavy rains continue to move north along the Red River. Fargo is still rising and is expected to reach minor flood stage late tonight. Abercrombie appears to be cresting and is forecast to crest below flood stage. For the Red River...including Wahpeton, Hickson, Fargo, Halstad, East Grand Forks, Oslo, Drayton, Pembina...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Fargo. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Low-level dam south of Main Ave is closed (Fargo). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Friday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 20.0 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. this morning at 1145 AM CST.
